content: stitches there are now 4 equal sections ready for the crown decreases crown decreases i recommend switching to magic loop or double pointed needles whenever it feels more comfortable round 1 * k2tog k to 2 stitches before marker k2tog repeat from * 3 more times round 2 same as round 1 round 3 k2 p2 to end of round round 4 same as round 3 round 5 same as round 1 round 6 same as round 1 round 7 p2 k2 to end of round round 8 same as round 7 repeat knitting rounds 1-8 until 24 stitches remain ending on a round 4 or 8 next round k2tog to end of round 12 stitches remaining break yarn and pull tail through remaining stitches finishing weave in the ends using the tapestry needle wet block the finished hat by soaking in water for a minimum of 15 minutes pressing out the water and setting out to dry drying can be done flat or on a mannequin head to avoid peaks in the crown wear happily while eating some waffles and please tag me on instagram with your finished object photos @emmyphilp i always love seeing your knits in the wild
